rows.text: "to serve as a United States Tender for carrying men, provisions, &c., on the rivers of Texas."
"for the ferry connecting Catherine street, New York, with South Tenth st., Williamsburgh."

"to be employed in towing about the harbor."
145ft tug, probably for New York service
USN gunboat, 1861-68. Destroyed by fire south of New Orleans, 1870
Built for Civil War service but sold on completion. Scrapped on or after 1878
Caught fire and sank off Charleston, S.C. 1867, 24 killed
"to be placed on the Grand and Houston street ferry"
Iron hull by Continental Iron Works
Iron hull by Continental Iron Works
"largest three-masted schooner ever built" in New York. Sank in storm off Cape Hatteras 1875, 8 killed
Shipped overland in sections to S.F. Destroyed by fire, 1884
